conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine collision time.
Car A starts at 25 m/s, Car B starts at 15 m/s.
Car A's velocity decreases linearly from 25 m/s to 0 m/s over 25 seconds; Car B's velocity decreases linearly from 15 m/s to 0 m/s over 30 seconds.
Equations of motion: For Car A: v_A = 25 - t; For Car B: v_B = 15 - 0.5t.
Position equations: For Car A: x_A = 25t - 0.5t^2; For Car B: x_B = 15t - 0.25t^2.
Collision condition: The cars collide when x_A = x_B.
Solutions: t = 0 (initial time, not relevant for collision), t = 40 seconds.
The cars collide after 40 seconds of braking.
The two cars collide after 20 seconds of braking.
